title: Elaine Hendrix of The Parent Trap to replace Nicollette Sheridan as Alexis on Dynasty
text:
She's best known to audiences as the fiancée Lindsay Lohan's characters had to keep away from Dennis Quaid in the 1998 remake of The Parent Trap.

Now Elaine Hendrix will find new life on screen as she takes over as Alexis on The CW's rebooted Dynasty.

The network announced that the 48–year–old actress would replace Nicollette Sheridan, who originated the role when the primetime soap debuted in 2017.

New face: Elaine Hendrix, 48, who played the devious fiancée in 1998's The Parent Trap, will take over the role of Alexis on Dynasty, The CW announced on Monday; pictured in March

The cast shakeup originated with a tragedy: Nicollette departed the series in order to spend time with her terminally ill mother.

Her last episode as Alexis aired in March of this year.

The series introduced a plot line in which Alexis was severely burned, necessitating monumental cosmetic surgery.

Elizabeth Gillies, who plays Fallon, temporarily took over the role during season two thanks to the character's extensive surgery.

'Alexis is back in Atlanta, with a new look, a new man, and plenty of scores to settle,' The CW said in a statement announcing Hendrix's casting.

Bowing out: The cast shakeup originated with a tragedy when Nicollette Sheridan departed the series in order to spend time with her terminally ill mother; still from Dynasty

Temporary fix: Elizabeth Gillies (2nd L), who plays Fallon, took over the role during season two thanks to the character's extensive plastic surgery; (L-R) Ana Brenda Contreras, Grant Snow, Gillies and Sheridan pictured

Prior to joining the Dynasty cast as a series regular, Elaine worked steadily in film and television as an in-demand guest actress.

She was a recurring character on the rebooted 90210 and Charlie Sheen's Anger Management, and was also a series regular on Dennis Leary's FX series Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll.

But it was her turn as the scheming stepmother–to–be in The Parent Trap that showed off her true knack for drama and deceit.

Elaine recently made news earlier this month when she joked on Twitter about her former co-star Dennis Quaid's new engagement to a woman nearly 40 years his junior.

'Watch out for those twins,' she wrote, adding two dancing girl emojis.

Age difference: Elaine recently made news earlier this month when she joked on Twitter about her former co-star Dennis Quaid's new engagement to a woman nearly 40 years his junior

Classic: Elaine's turn as the scheming stepmother–to–be in The Parent Trap that showed off her true knack for drama and deceit

Popular: She was a recurring character on the rebooted 90210 and Charlie Sheen's Anger Management, and was also a series regular on Dennis Leary's FX series Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll; pictured in April

Dynasty's third season has been airing since October 11, though The CW's casting announcement didn't specify when Elaine would beginning appearing on the show.

It was previously reported that recurring castmembers Daniella Alonso (Cristal), Adam Huber (Liam), Michael Michele (Dominique) and Sam Underwood (Adam) had also been bumped up to series regulars.

She'll have big shoes to fill with the backstabbing role, which was played on the original 1980s series by Joan Collins, 86.

Collins joined the fledgling series in its second season, and her arrival is generally credited with rescuing the show's ratings and making it a viable competitor to the more popular primetime soap Dallas.
description: Elaine Hendrix of 1998's The Parent Trap will be joining the cast of The CW's Dynasty reboot as a surgically altered Alexis. The devious character was previously played by Nicollette Sheridan.
